title: Bottom half is fraktur, top half is sans
content:
Does anyone know what I’m talking about here? the bottom half has all the flourishes and fun bits of fraktur, but the top is a nice simple sans. Any help?

 [‹ Despite a paper-thin plot, 'Gutenberg' delivers](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222753/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31115 "Go to previous forum topic") [Microsoft XPS versus Adobe PDF ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222753/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31032 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fwistard

comments.content:
Do you mean the Centralschrift?  
The upper half is a serifed roman, though.  
Something similar is available from [http://www.haroldsfonts.com/kombine.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222753/http:/www.haroldsfonts.com/kombine.html "http://www.haroldsfonts.com/kombine.html")
fraktendon is it. Thanks you’re the best guys!! :-\*

Also the Full Sail Brewing logo...

[http://www.fullsailbrewing.com/default.cfm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222753/http:/www.fullsailbrewing.com/default.cfm "http://www.fullsailbrewing.com/default.cfm")

Cheers, Si

The Royal Family by Patrick Giasson. [http://typophile.com/node/16352](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222753/http:/typophile.com/node/16352 "http://typophile.com/node/16352")  
Unfortunately pulled-off the market.
